title: Chorizo, Red Pepper, and Potato Galette with Arugula
summary: Chorizo, Red Pepper, and Potato Galette with Arugula might be just the side dish you are searching for. For 92 cents per serving, this recipe covers 11% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 197 calories, 10g of protein, and 13g of fat. This recipe serves 4. A mixture of baby arugula, roasted bell peppers, pie dough, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. 1 person found this recipe to be flavorful and satisfying. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 49%. This score is pretty good. Try Potato, Pepper, And Chorizo Empa√±adas, Potato, pepper & chorizo stew with fried eggs, and Potato, Pepper and Chorizo Hash with Fried Eggs for similar recipes.
instructions: Preheat oven to 425. Lay out a sheet of parchment paper, unroll pie dough on top, and roll into a 13-in. round. Set on a rimless baking sheet.                                                                                                 Leaving a 2-in. border, scatter cheese, chorizo, potatoes, and peppers over dough.                                                                                                 Fold dough edges over filling, then bake until crust is golden and cheese is melted, 20 to 25 minutes.                                                                                                 Toss arugula with vinegar and oil in a small bowl until coated. Scatter over galette. Cut into wedges and serve immediately.                                                                                                *We especially like Pillsbury pie dough. Look for Barinaga Ranch Baserri, a California farmstead cheese sold at specialty shops, or use manchego.                                                                                                Note: Nutritional analysis is per serving.

steps.step: Lay out a sheet of parchment paper, unroll pie dough on top, and roll into a 13-in. round. Set on a rimless baking sheet.
Leaving a 2-in. border, scatter cheese, chorizo, potatoes, and peppers over dough.
Fold dough edges over filling, then bake until crust is golden and cheese is melted, 20 to 25 minutes.
Toss arugula with vinegar and oil in a small bowl until coated. Scatter over galette.
Cut into wedges and serve immediately.
*We especially like Pillsbury pie dough. Look for Barinaga Ranch Baserri, a California farmstead cheese sold at specialty shops, or use manchego.
